materials.raw_text: B4 (Boron) - 20 g, Be2 (Beryllium) - 10 g, Co5 (Cobalt) - 50 g, Ni4 (Nickel) - 40 g, Tm3 (Thulium) - 15 g

sourcing.instructions: B (Boron) - Chemical supply stores or online suppliers; Be (Beryllium) - Specialty metal suppliers or online sources; Co (Cobalt) - Metal suppliers; Ni (Nickel) - Metal suppliers; Tm (Thulium) - Rare earth metal suppliers.
steps: B (Boron) - Chemical supply stores or online suppliers; Be (Beryllium) - Specialty metal suppliers or online sources; Co (Cobalt) - Metal suppliers; Ni (Nickel) - Metal suppliers; Tm (Thulium) - Rare earth metal suppliers.

1. Weigh all materials using a precise balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine B, Be, Co, Ni, and Tm in the specified amounts. 3. Mix thoroughly using a mechanical stirrer for 10 minutes to ensure uniformity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh all materials using a precise balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine B, Be, Co, Ni, and Tm in the specified amounts. 3. Mix thoroughly using a mechanical stirrer for 10 minutes to ensure uniformity.

steps: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1200째C. 2. Place the mixed powder in a graphite crucible. 3. Heat gradually to 1200째C and maintain for 2 hours to promote sintering.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1200째C. 2. Place the mixed powder in a graphite crucible. 3. Heat gradually to 1200째C and maintain for 2 hours to promote sintering.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature over a period of 4-6 hours. 2. Avoid quenching to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature over a period of 4-6 hours. 2. Avoid quenching to prevent cracking.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to trim the sample to exact dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to trim the sample to exact dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface.
